bill_title: revise the provisions relating to the establishment of separate market values in neighborhoods.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the provisions relating to the establishment of separate market values in neighborhoods. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 10-6-33.6 be amended to read as follows: 10-6-33.6. If the median value per acre in an identifiable region within a county deviates by more than ten percent from the county average median value per acre , the county director of equalization may establish a separate market value per acre for the land defined by the director of equalization within that identifiable region. Such separate market value shall be based upon the requirements for property assessments pursuant to this chapter. For purposes of calculating whether a ten percent deviation exists, there shall be a minimum of five sales of agricultural land within such identifiable region during the calendar year immediately preceding the assessment year. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the provisions relating to the establishment of separate market values in neighborhoods. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 10-6-33.6 be amended to read as follows: 10-6-33.6. If the median market value per acre in an identifiable region within a county deviates by more than ten percent from the county average median market value per acre , the county director of equalization may establish a separate market value per acre for the land defined by the director of equalization within that identifiable region. Such separate market value shall be based upon the requirements for property assessments pursuant to this chapter. For purposes of calculating whether a ten percent deviation exists, there shall be a minimum of five sales of agricultural land within such identifiable region during the assessment year immediately preceding the current assessment year. If there are less than five sales in the identifiable region, the director of equalization shall use sales of agricultural land within the identifiable region from the previous three years. BILL HISTORY 1/21/00 First read in Senate and referred to Taxation. S.J. 140 2/2/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/2/00 Taxation Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 5, NAYS 3. S.J. 285

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the provisions relating to the establishment of separate market values in neighborhoods. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 10-6-33.6 be amended to read as follows: 10-6-33.6. If the median market value per acre in an identifiable region within a county deviates by more than ten percent from the county average median market value per acre , the county director of equalization may establish a separate market value per acre for the land defined by the director of equalization within that identifiable region. Such separate market value shall be based upon the requirements for property assessments pursuant to this chapter. For purposes of calculating whether a ten percent deviation exists, there shall be a minimum of five sales of agricultural land within such identifiable region during the assessment year immediately preceding the current assessment year. If an identifiable region is established pursuant to this section such identifiable region shall remain until there are sufficient sales during an assessment year to establish inequitable valuation or valuations in excess of full and true to the property owners within the identifiable region. BILL HISTORY 1/21/00 First read in Senate and referred to Taxation. S.J. 140 2/2/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/2/00 Taxation Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 5, NAYS 3. S.J. 285 2/4/00 Senate Deferred to another day. S.J. 322 2/7/00 Motion to Amend, Passed. S.J. 333 2/7/00 Senate Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 34, NAYS 0. S.J. 333
